physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The patient was sedated, intubated; inspiratory crackles at both lung bases; bronchial breath sounds in right upper and left mid-to-lower lung zones; grade 2 systolic murmur at left sternal border; abdominal examination normal; no peripheral edema, digital clubbing or cyanosis; rectal examination unremarkable; neurologic examination normal.
Chest radiograph showed partial clearing of right upper lobe consolidation; pleural effusions smaller compared to previous state; persistent diffuse interstitial edema.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Improvement in right upper lobe consolidation, persistent interstitial edema.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Reintubation required due to increasing respiratory distress; persistent patchy opacities in both lungs; unchanged pleural effusions.
Coarse breath sounds over lungs; diffuse air-space opacities noted; bilateral ground-glass opacities and consolidations; moderate-to-large bilateral pleural effusions.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Worsening respiratory distress and slight improvement in aeration despite reintubation.
